intro: Thamnosma texana var. purpurea, commonly known as the purpleleaf thamnosma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its purple-tinged foliage and yellow flowers make it a distinctive ornamental plant. It is often found in Texas and New Mexico, where it thrives in full sun.
